top_categories.workout_context: BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah)'s Utah red rock gravel (70%), Paved roads (30%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 84 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah)'s demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
At mile 60 of 84, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
117ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah), surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
9,843ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah). Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah), that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
9,843ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 84 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Utah red rock—high desert technical terrain. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Low-cadence force work for 9,843ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.heat: May in Cedar City, Utah can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah). Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah)’s 84 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah). Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah) demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride utah red rock—high desert technical terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: utah red rock gravel (70%), paved roads (30%), high desert. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 84 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Durability to prepare you for 84 miles of utah red rock—high desert technical terrain in Cedar City, Utah.
